com.concordium.sdk.transactions.smartcontracts

Class SchemaParameter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.concordium.sdk.transactions.smartcontracts.SchemaParameter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccountAddressParam, AddressParam, ContractAddressParam, ListParam

    public abstract class SchemaParameter
extends Object
    Represents smart contract parameters serializable via a Schema.

    Classes representing smart contract parameters should extend this, and ensure that they are JSON serializable in accordance with the provided smart contract schema.

    Fields in the extending class, that should be serialized, must be visible to the serializer. Visible fields are:

    • Fields with 'getter' methods (either user-created or by @Getter annotation).
    • All fields in a class annotated with '@JsonAutoDetect(fieldVisibility = JsonAutoDetect.Visibility.ANY)'. Fields can be excluded from this with the '@JsonIgnore' annotation.
    • Fields annotated with '@JsonProperty'. These have both getter and setter methods generated.
    • Public fields
    If default serialization does not work, a custom serializer should be implemented and used with annotation '@JsonSerialize(using = MyCustomSerializer.class)'. See AbstractAddress for an example of a custom serializer.

    Parameter must be initialized by calling initialize() before usage.

    For functions not expecting parameters use Parameter.EMPTY instead.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected SchemaParameter(Schema schema, InitName initName)
      Creates a SchemaParameter of type ParameterType.INIT for use with InitContractPayload.
      protected SchemaParameter(Schema schema, ReceiveName receiveName)
      Creates a SchemaParameter of type ParameterType.RECEIVE for use with UpdateContractPayload and InvokeInstanceRequest.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SchemaParameter

        protected SchemaParameter(Schema schema,
                          InitName initName)
        Creates a SchemaParameter of type ParameterType.INIT for use with InitContractPayload. Parameter must be initialized with initialize() before use.
        Parameters:
        schema - Schema of the module.
        initName - The name of the contract to be initialized with the parameter.

      • SchemaParameter

        protected SchemaParameter(Schema schema,
                          ReceiveName receiveName)
        Creates a SchemaParameter of type ParameterType.RECEIVE for use with UpdateContractPayload and InvokeInstanceRequest. Parameter must be initialized with initialize() before use.
        Parameters:
        schema - Schema of the module.
        receiveName - ReceiveName containing the name of the contract and method to be updated/invoked with the parameter.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initializes the parameter by ensuring serialization is performed correctly. This is required before the parameter is used. Use initialize(boolean) with parameter 'true' for more descriptive errors.
        Throws:
        CryptoJniException - if the serialization could not be performed.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(boolean verboseErrors)
        Initializes the parameter by ensuring serialization is performed correctly. This is required before the parameter is used.
        Parameters:
        verboseErrors - whether to return errors in a verbose format or not, can be useful when debugging why serialization fails. Defaults to false if omitted.
        Throws:
        CryptoJniException - if the serialization could not be performed.

      • toBytes

        public byte[] toBytes()
        Converts the serialized parameter to a byte[]. Should only be called after parameter is initialized with initialize().
        Returns:
        byte[] containing the serialized parameter.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if parameter is not initialized.

      • toJson

        public String toJson()
        Returns the JSON representation of the parameter. This is the exactly what is sent to the rust layer for serialization when initialize() is called.
        Returns:
        the JSON representation of the parameter.

      • getSchema

        public Schema getSchema()
        Schema of the module.

      • getInitName

        public InitName getInitName()
        InitName containing the name of the contract to be initialized with the parameter. Populated if and only if type is ParameterType.INIT

      • getReceiveName

        public ReceiveName getReceiveName()
        ReceiveName containing the name of the contract and method to be updated/invoked with the parameter. Populated if and only if type is ParameterType.RECEIVE.

      • isInitialized

        public boolean isInitialized()
        Whether the parameter has been initialized. Parameter should always be initialized with initialize() before being used to create initialize/update/invoke transactions/requests.

      • getType

        public ParameterType getType()
        Type of the parameter. ParameterType.INIT to be used with InitContractPayload. ParameterType.RECEIVE to be used with UpdateContractPayload and InvokeInstanceRequest.
